meanings.definition: To treat or represent (something abstract) as a concrete reality.
meanings.sent1: In her story, she hypostatizes courage as a brave knight.
meanings.sent2: The artist hypostatizes emotions through vibrant colors in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The children's book hypostatizes kindness as a magical fairy spreading joy.
meanings.sent4: His music hypostatizes love, filling the room with warmth and tenderness.
meanings.sent5: The movie hypostatizes dreams, showing them coming to life on screen.

meanings.definition: To attribute concrete existence to (something abstract).
meanings.sent1: The ancient legend hypostatizes the power of nature in the form of a mystical tree.
meanings.sent2: Some cultures hypostatize the concept of fate as a thread woven by invisible hands.
meanings.sent3: The comedian jokingly hypostatized procrastination as a mischievous imp causing delays.
meanings.sent4: Her poetry hypostatizes memories, turning them into tangible objects to hold.
meanings.sent5: The author's words hypostatize imagination, inviting readers into fantastical worlds.

meanings.definition: To give substance or form to (an abstract concept).
meanings.sent1: The sculptor hypostatizes beauty in the graceful curves of the marble statue.
meanings.sent2: Through dance, she hypostatizes the rhythm of life in graceful movements.
meanings.sent3: The chef hypostatizes flavors, creating a symphony of tastes on the plate.
meanings.sent4: His speech hypostatizes hope, lifting spirits with each inspiring word.
meanings.sent5: The architect hypostatizes creativity, shaping buildings that defy convention.
